title: Slayer task/Elves

properties.name: description
properties.value: Elves can be assigned as a slayer task at level 70 combat by various slayer masters after completion of Regicide. Elves are mainly found in Tirannwn and some in the Mourner Headquarters in West Ardougne until the events of Song of the Elves. They are initially found at the Iorwerth Camp in Isafdar, with more locations becoming available if the player starts the Mourning's End Part I and again if they complete Song of the Elves. Attackable elves wield either bows or halberds and use either ranged or melee accordingly.

Elves can be assigned as a slayer task at level 70 combat by various slayer masters after completion of Regicide. Elves are mainly found in Tirannwn and some in the Mourner Headquarters in West Ardougne until the events of Song of the Elves. They are initially found at the Iorwerth Camp in Isafdar, with more locations becoming available if the player starts the Mourning's End Part I and again if they complete Song of the Elves. Attackable elves wield either bows or halberds and use either ranged or melee accordingly.

Archers have a lower combat level than the warriors, and attack with ranged, which means they cannot be safespotted.

Warriors, mourners and guards attack with melee, but are harder to safespot as they wield halberds and as such have an attack radius of 2 tiles rather than 1.

It is generally recommended to use Protect from Missiles and Protect from Melee accordingly. All elves, except those at the Iorwerth Camp, can be found within reasonable distance to an altar.

Before Song of the Elves and after Mourning's End Part II a player can use the Dark Beast teleport of the slayer ring to quickly access Mourners, and the Ardougne cloak monastery teleport to quickly recharge prayer.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Iorwerth Archer 90 105
  • Iorwerth Camp
  • Elves wielding bows, available after starting Regicide. They become aggressive after certain events during Song of the Elves, but passive again after completion.
Elf Archer 90 105
  • Lletya
  • Elves wielding bows, only available after starting Mourning's End Part I.
Iorwerth Warrior 108 107.5
  • Iorwerth Camp
  • Iorwerth Dungeon
  • Elves wielding halberds, available after starting Regicide. They become aggressive after certain events during Song of the Elves, but passive again after completion.
Elf Warrior 108 107.5
  • Lletya
  • Elves wielding halberds, available after starting Mourning's End Part I.
Mourners 108 107.5
  • Mourner Headquarters
  • Elves wielding halberds, only available during and after Mourning's End Part I, but not after Song of the Elves.
  • If you do not want to be automatically attacked then full Mourner Gear must be worn at all times while in Mourner Headquarters
Guards 108 107.5
  • Prifddinas
  • Elves wielding halberds, available after Song of the Elves.

Location Comparison[edit | edit source]

 This article is currently in the middle of an expansion or major revamping.
The information contained within it should not be considered fully accurate and/or complete. You can help by contributing to it.
Location Maplink Amount Multicombat Cannonable Safespottable Notes
Iorwerth Camp 12 (6 Archers, 6 Warriors) No Yes Yes
  • Both Iorwerth Archers and Iorwerth Warriors are found at the Iorwerth Camp.
Iorwerth Dungeon 13 No Yes Yes
  • Requires completion of Song of the Elves.
  • Only contains Iorwerth Warriors.
Lletya 4 (1 Archer upstairs , 1 Archer and 2 Warriors ground level) No Yes Yes
  • Both Elf Archers and Elf Warriors are found around Lletya.
  • Use the bench near the entrance to safe spot Elf Warriors.
Mourner Headquarters 4 (downstairs) No No Yes
  • Only available after starting Mourning's End Part I and until the Ardougne Revolution during Song of the Elves.
  • Mourner Gear must be equipped at all times to access this area unless you have completed Mourning's End Part II, after which you can use the Dark Beast teleport of the Slayer Ring
Prifddinas South Gate 2 No Yes Unknown
Prifddinas East Gate 2 No Yes Unknown
Prifddinas North Gate 2 No Yes Unknown
Prifddinas West Gate 2 No Yes Unknown
Tower of Voices ground floor[UK]1st floor[US] 4 No Yes Yes
  • One is found at each entrance to the tower.
Tower of Voices 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] 8 No Yes No
  • Found on the walkways between the towers of Prifddinas. Great distances between each.
Prifddinas market place 3 No Yes Yes
  • Shoot over Glenda

Exceptions[edit | edit source]

  • Mourners at any level other than 108 does not count towards a Slayer task.
  • The Elven traitor, Essylt and all other elves fought during Song of the Elves do not count towards a Slayer task either.

[[Elves]] can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] at level 70 [[combat]] by various [[slayer masters]] after completion of [[Regicide]]. Elves are mainly found in [[Tirannwn]] and some in the [[Mourner Headquarters]] in [[West Ardougne]] until the events of [[Song of the Elves]]. They are initially found at the [[Iorwerth Camp]] in [[Isafdar]], with more locations becoming available if the player starts the [[Mourning's End Part I]] and again if they complete [[Song of the Elves]]. Attackable elves wield either bows or halberds and use either [[ranged]] or [[melee]] accordingly. 

Archers have a lower combat level than the warriors, and attack with ranged, which means they cannot be safespotted.

Warriors, mourners and guards attack with melee, but are harder to safespot as they wield [[halberd]]s and as such have an attack radius of 2 tiles rather than 1.

It is generally recommended to use [[Protect from Missiles]] and [[Protect from Melee]] accordingly. All elves, except those at the Iorwerth Camp, can be found within reasonable distance to an [[altar]]. 

Before [[Song of the Elves]] and after [[Mourning's End Part II]]  a player can use the Dark Beast teleport of the [[slayer  ring]] to quickly access Mourners, and the [[Ardougne cloak 1|Ardougne cloak]] monastery teleport to quickly recharge prayer.
